children.text: The brickwork has been installed hard up to the underside of the beams, not allowing the frame to move/shrink as it settles.
Part 3.3.1.10 Shrinkage Allowance for Timber Framing of the NCC’s Building Code of Australia requires that

‘In masonry veneer walls a gap must be left between the timber frame and the top of the masonry wall, including window sills etc, to allow for settlement of the timber framing caused by timber shrinkage. These clearances must be not less than 5mm at sills of lower and single storey windows; and 8mm at roof overhangs of single storey buildings’ .
Additionally, Australian Standard AS 4773 - Masonry for Small Buildings requires in clause 9.5 Allowance for timber shrinkage, that
‘Consideration shall be given to timber shrinkage’ .
The brickwork below these beams will need to be lowered to achieve the required clearance in accordance with above.
